resources.res:
Your KTML session is corrupt. To prevent losing your work, please copy all content to another text editor application.
This may happen because you are running a firewall application that is blocking cookies. Please configure it to allow cookies.

Your KTML session is corrupt. To prevent losing your work, please copy all content to another text editor application.
This may happen because:
[1.] You are running a firewall application that is blocking cookies. Please configure it to allow cookies.
[2.] You have set < sessionState mode="InProc" /> in web.config and you are creating/renaming/deleting folders using the KTML File Explorer. Change that setting to < sessionState mode="StateServer" />. You also have to start ASP.NET State Service on the web server.
KTML Security failed. Invalid argument: "%s".
KTML Security failed. Module "%s" not registered for KTML id: "%s".
KTML Security failed. Method "%s" not supported in module "%s" for KTML id: "%s".
KTML Service Provider error. No module was called.
KTML Service Provider error. File for module "%s" does not exist.
KTML Service Provider error. Class "%s" does not exist in module "%s".
KTML Service Provider error. No method was called.
KTML Service Provider error. Method "%s" does not exist in class "%s" for module "%s".
%s module error. Argument "%s" is required.
%s module error. Argument "%s" is invalid.
Cannot restore image. %s
Cannot complete operation on file. Check that you have read and write permissions for this folder. %s
File Error. File destination already exists: %s.
Skipping '%s'. Error reading image properties.%s
Cannot complete operation on folder. %s
Cannot modify image. Make sure you have configured an image processing library. %s
Cannot access template file. Make sure you have read and write permissions on the templates folder. %s
Error uploading file: %s
The aspell library was not detected on the server. Please install aspell in order to be able to use the KTML spellchecker. Error returned: %s
Cannot convert to XHTML. Make sure you have HTML Tidy installed. Error returned: %s

Couldn't read folder.
Error retuned: %s.
%s module error. Argument "%s" is empty.

This operation is not allowed by the current web security settings.
Please set trust level to "Full" in 'web.config'
Skipping '%s'. Maximum allowed image dimensions are %s x %s%s.
Cannot create temporary folders. Please contact your system administrator.
Please empty your browser cache. You have an older version than the current version on the server. On the server: %s; on the client:
> Error in remote spellcheck service. %s
> Error in remote spellcheck service. Error sending request to server.
> Error in remote spellcheck service. Error reading response from server.
> Error in remote spellcheck service. HTTP error: %s
> Error in remote spellcheck service. Service returned: %s
> You are not allowed to connect to this service. You have reach the maximum number of request (%s) in %s seconds.
